ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: I spent about 5 hours a week completing the assigned readings, and spent many more hours when papers were due.
5 - 12 hours/ week, depending if an assignment was due that week.
6-8 hours
5-6hours
4 (except when assignments were due- then many more)
4-15, depending on whether there was a paper due or not.
3 hours
4-6 hours a week
About 8.
2-4 hours/ week (8-10 hours/ week in 2 weeks preceding paper due dates)

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: This is a great course for anyone interested in the field of public health. I enjoyed doing the readings and then having discussions about them in class with Professor Bradley. It made a lot of sense to do a great deal of groupwork in this class since teams were the main topic we discussed, and I enjoyed the groupwork a lot. Though the second paper was the most challenging group assignment I have ever done, it was also the most rewarding and I think my best product of a group assignment. The papers were interesting, but I thought very challenging and sometimes wished I had more direction.

This class was amazing! I learned so much. The readings were really interesting and lectures were incredibly engaging. One recommendation I would make would be for the groups to have a one-on-one meeting with Erika or Betsy.
MY FAVORITE CLASS OF THE SEMESTER. I GAINED A NUMBER OF PRACTICAL SKILLS THAT I HAVE ALREADY STARTED INCORPORATING INTO MY DAILY LIFE.

I thought it was great. I think the final project should be a presentation. This would draw on more skills and strengths of the groups. For those who are not the best writers they were at a huge disadvantage. Public speaking is key to leadership role and management.
Excellent course. Readings were very thought provoking and discussions made me eager to come to class every week.

Such an important but overlooked topic. Love the group experience and interactiveness of lecture and section. I recommend including more group experiences though, perhaps small challenges/puzzles to solve during each lecture with different groups. I also suggest eliminating the final paper-- the group experience was much more climatic and this paper seems a little out of left field, definitely lacking momentum and motivation.

Really very helpful. The name may seem vague but this is the single most useful class I have taken over my Fall. The concepts learned can be used for a lot of different settings.It can be improved may be by adding some cases to solve and making better use of the time allotted to the discussion sections.

This was an interesting experience, because it was the first semester this course was offered. As such, it was a little rough around the edges: there is room for improvement regarding the format of class assignments (which we have processed as a class at great length). The reading list was also dynamic, in that what we actually were asked to read for class differed from the syllabus about half the time. I can appreciate that real-time adjustments were being made to refine the topics covered; however stability was sacrificed a bit. For example, I would want to start the week's reading a week ahead of time, but found that half of the things I read were then jettisioned by the instructor at the last minute. I responded by starting the reading only a few days before class each week; however this made it more difficult to balance the coursework from my other classes because of the short lead time.

AMAZING COURSE. The course concepts are applicable to any facet of personal or professional life, public health or not. I feel I now have an arsenal of strategies to use in group situations and leadership contexts. Best class I've taken at YSPH.

strengths are Professor Bradley, how involved she tries to get students (even in Winslow), and how she makes concepts practical.weaknesses are just the size of the class, and final paper did not feel like a good culmination of class.
This course was quite good. The readings were usually excellent and I learned a lot of relevant information for future group work.
Great course. A must course at YSPH
Great course.
Biggest strength- INSTRUCTOR!!!! And syllabus, classroom discussions, team dynamics exercises, required readings...everything.

This course was a good course. It opened my eyes to the whole study of leadership. Dr. Bradley is a knowledgeable, energetic, and dedicated teacher. She chose some interesting readings. She attempted to teach us in an "experiential" way about areas of leadership, with varying degrees of success, though she deserves credit for trying. The one downside of the course is that we had very little reading on certain subjects and talked about them only superficially in class, but we were expected to understand and apply them.
Feedback has been given to the instructor and TA already.
Strengths: Real world application of conceptsWeaknesses: The lack of a case book or public health related case studies

Great in-class discussions that elicit unique responses from students who are often encouraged to draw on personal experience. The group essay was quite difficult, and perhaps that process can be improved

Excellent course that addresses specific aspects of leadership as it applies to public health and more generally as well. Significant emphasis on project teams was very helpful. Viewing attributes of successful leadership was critical, particularly as it related to complex challenges. Very practical basis for interaction in future endeavors.

Strengths:- excellent, intentional, engaging instruction- breadth of leadership theories explored- lots of readings/ examples of leadership in public health-related scenarios- lots of variation in schools of thought explored in leadership readings -- business, health, program evaluation, philosophy, etc.Weaknesses:- lack of casing (e.g., HBR case studies and problem analysis, troubleshooting-oriented instruction prior to the "answer"/ course of action revealed)- assignments were all papers -- would have been very cool to have a practitioner present a dilemma (that they grappled with and determined a course of action for) to the class, class splits into groups (same groups or new groups) to work on a solution and slide deck describing solution, have each group present to class and practitioner and receive grade based on content, leadership landscape analysis, presentation skills, creativity, etc., and once all groups present, practitioner presents what their team's decision-making process and leadership landscape was and what course of action was. Then subsequent class/ last class debrief would allow forclass discussion.

Great readings, nice discussions in class, good job by prof.The fist paper was a little confusing. I wish the prof had taken more time in class to give examples of what we could have talked about and run us through writing it (like she did for the final paper). I spent a lot of time just figuring out what I was supposed to do for that paper; for example, didn't realize I could have used a personal example at the beginning.
This course is fantastic and should be a required course for management AND policy students. The topics covered and lessons learned are applicable to so many situations.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  It was a privilege to take a course with Professor Bradley - her experience as a hospital executive and successful academic made her teaching that much more effective and interesting. Professor Bradley made everyone feel like their input was valued and was able to tie all comments back to the bigger picture.
Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  Betsy is amazing! Absolutely amazing!!
Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  AMAZING! INVESTED, ENERGETIC, AND INSIGHTFUL.
Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  Genius Level 5. Kind. Fun. Smart.
Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  Betsy is the perfect instructor to teach leadership and the type of person I would like to emulate.
Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  Betsy is amazing and so warm! She created such a fun and safe learning environment.
Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  Amazing professor. Understands the tone of the class and keeps it very engaging. The material even though its extensive is very helpful and interesting.

Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  Betsy is amazing. She creates a wonderful atmosphere of psychological safety so that every student, no matter what theiracademic background, feels secure in contributing to class discussions. She practices what she preaches, leadership wise. It was a wonderful conclusion to the class to hash out the experiences of the semester over dinner at Branford. Definitely keep that component :)
Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  Wonderful

Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  Betsy is engaging, fun, and brilliant. She has such a nuanced understanding of the materials. Her expectations are high, but if you stay on top of the hefty reading load, it's well worth it.
Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  Best professor I've had. She's great all around. So knowledgeable and still down to earth and accessible.

Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  Professor Bradley is an excellent professor. She is the most personable and engaging professor I had this semester and truly cares about her students. Lectures were very thorough and well-organized, and the inclusion of a good deal of class participation and activities kept me engaged for the full class period. I would take another course with her in a heartbeat.
Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  Prof. Bradley- teacher of the year for me
Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  Excellent and funny speaker. Made learning alot of fun and kept students engaged always.
Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  One of the best instructors I've ever had- inspiring, respectful, self-aware, truly inspires us to learn the material and live it...

Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  Dr. Bradley is very knowledgeable about the area of leadership. She is an energetic and dedicated teacher. She is very pleasant and nice. She tried to design tasks that would give us a real experience of some of the topics we were studying, with varying degrees of success, but she gets credit for trying.
Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  Feedback has been given to the instructor and TA already.
Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  Excellent teacher, great lecturer, engages well with students.

Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  Fantastic instructor! It was a class I looked forward to every week and the two hours in class just flew by. She is dynamic, engaging and really made the class so interesting!

Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  Excellent instructor. Constantly reinforcing themes of leadership through projects, readings, and examples. Very open to questions, interactions and discussions. Provided excellent feedback when indicated.
Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  Excellent. So glad I was able to take this course. Thank you for being so approachable, intentional, and graceful -- great embodiment of leadership.

Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  Betsy is great! I like how she reviews at the beginning of each class. I think she had her favorites in class, but that's ok. Sometimes I would say something in class and it was pretty clear she didn't like my comment, but I guess it's good to have that feedback sometimes.
Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  Excellent

Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  Dr. Bradley is a top notch instructor. She is obviously technically and academically astute and even more so, she gives every comment her focused attention and really makes people feel heard despite what they say! This is truly a gift.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Instructor: Erika Marie Rogan  Erika was a wonderful TA. She led meaningful and relevant discussion sections and was always available to help me discuss my ideas for the paper. I am grateful for Erika's time and dedication.
Instructor: Erika Marie Rogan  Erika was super helpful and always gave really useful feedback. She is really engaging and is a wonderful TA.
Instructor: Erika Marie Rogan  DID A GREAT JOB IN LEADING DISCUSSION.
Instructor: Erika Marie Rogan  Genius Level 3. Kind. Fun. Smart.
Instructor: Erika Marie Rogan  Excellent at leading discussions and always available for providing feedback.
Instructor: Erika Marie Rogan  Probably one of the best TA's I've had- so interested in learning everyone's perspective and sharing alternatives

Instructor: Erika Marie Rogan  Erika did a great job of providing insight/resources for paper topics and facilitating section discussions. A logistical note: I would make it clearer for students upon registration that this class requires 2 hrs a week PLUS an hour of recitation. I know that caught some of us off guard.
Instructor: Erika Marie Rogan  Wonderful and very helpful
Instructor: Erika Marie Rogan  Erika was extremely responsive to any questions and got us to really think about the concepts in novel ways. I enjoyed discussion section.
Instructor: Erika Marie Rogan  Great TF. Keeps students in the loop, provides good feedback, and accessible.
Instructor: Erika Marie Rogan  Erika is great! She was very well organized and had a good command over the classroom. I always felt like I gained something from section, which is not often true.
Instructor: Erika Marie Rogan  One of the best TFs you will find at YSPH.
Instructor: Erika Marie Rogan  Very accurate, and responsive. Great TA.

Instructor: Erika Marie Rogan  FABULOUS teaching assistant...even though sections were not necessarily useful, Erika was great at getting the students to engage in discussion, and thoughtfully led us to think more deeply about the material.
Instructor: Erika Marie Rogan  Erika Rogan did a good job. She was accessible and helpful. She was very competent at leading the small group discussions.
Instructor: Erika Marie Rogan  Feedback has been given to the instructor and TA already.
Instructor: Erika Marie Rogan  Great at giving feedback and leading class discussions.
Instructor: Erika Marie Rogan  Amazing
Instructor: Erika Marie Rogan  Erika was fantastic! The sections she led were engaging and dynamic and she offered great advice for the assignments and the group work.

Instructor: Erika Marie Rogan  Erika was excellent in her support for the course. She led small group discussions and her presentations were balanced and insightful. She made herself available to supply extra help when necessary. Overall superior.
Instructor: Erika Marie Rogan  She was great!
Instructor: Erika Marie Rogan  Great job -- very approachable, embroiled in leadership theories alongside students, making it very easy to talk through analyses questions and thoughts
Instructor: Erika Marie Rogan  Erika was great!! Very helpful and available. Great.
Instructor: Erika Marie Rogan  Excellent

Instructor: Erika Marie Rogan  Erika, similarly to Dr. Bradley, is a great listener and she gives each student's feedback her utmost attention. She is reasonable and respectful and I would welcome her as a TA in any course.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This course covers main leadership concepts both in theory and practice. You learn the concepts through interesting readings, which are discussed and analyzed in the lecture. You do a great deal of individual reflection as well as group work in this course. There is also a discussion section that is used to flesh out concepts of interest and make them more meaningful for life after Yale. I would definitely recommend this course, but caution anyone taking it that it is certainly challenging!
This is such a useful and fun class. I would absolutely recommend it.
A MUST TAKE. LIFE CHANGING.
Hello fellow student. If you dont take this class you are a sheep. You hear me. A SHEEEEEEEEEP!
This is what you think of when you think of taking a "Yale" course.
This course will teach you something you can use in all aspects of life. For once, you could actually have a great group experience! You will get to know both your classmates and professor/TA well.
Very very highly recommended for every student.

One of the best courses I've taken at Yale so far. Helps students learn skills to work in leadership roles and understand the benefits of group work. Addresses content in interesting and fun ways, not just a lecture.

Professor Bradley is amazing. If you can take a course with her do, regardless of what the course is. This course was quite good--not your typical leadership course. I really felt like I took away skills that are applicable to future group work and jobs.
Highly highly recommend it!
Yes, great course, lots to learn and utilize in daily life scenarios.

This should be required of every student in the HCM and Policy tracks, and should be taken by anyone in any school who thinks they may ever have to interact with other humans as part of a group, and especially by those who hope to one day fulfill a leadership role within an organization, or in general in life. (Excuse the rambling...in summary- yes. Recommended to everyone.)

This course was a good course. It opened my eyes to the whole study of leadership. Dr. Bradley is a knowledgeable, energetic, and dedicated teacher. She chose some interesting readings. She attempted to teach us in an "experiential" way about areas of leadership, with varying degrees of success, though she deserves credit for trying. The one downside of the course is that we had very little reading on certain subjects and talked about them only superficially in class, but we were expected to understand and apply them.
Good course, recommended!
Definitely worth taking if one is interested in understanding leadership and the best principles in solving significant challenges.
Definitely!

This class was my favorite class this semester. I would definitely recommend it! It taught some very practical skills which can be applied almost anywhere from professional environments to any situation where one is working in a group.

Excellent course on leadership skills applicable to public health and other fields. Specific group project during the term with attention to group dynamics as discussed in the text. Assigned readings were relevant and helped clarify major themes.
What a great course! Take it if you can.
Definitely recommend it for kiddos in every concentration. Useful and different from your typical YSPH course.
